body_html:
I think it is a bug in tensorflow 1.1.0.
I downgraded to tensorflow 1.0.0, and it works.

Here are the lines from my Dockerfile:

FROM nvidia/cuda:8.0-devel-ubuntu16.04

RUN pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.0.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

# RUN pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.1.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

I downgraded to tensorflow 1.0.0, and it works.
Here are the lines from my Dockerfile:
FROM nvidia/cuda:8.0-devel-ubuntu16.04

RUN pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.0.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

# RUN pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.1.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl
body:
I think it is a bug in tensorflow 1.1.0.
I downgraded to tensorflow 1.0.0, and it works.

Here are the lines from my Dockerfile:


```
FROM nvidia/cuda:8.0-devel-ubuntu16.04

RUN pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.0.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

# RUN pip install https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-1.1.0-cp27-none-linux_x86_64.whl

```
